page.title: 07Education in Newton Aycliffe
page.content: Declining birth-rate resulted in the amalgamation of six schools in Newton Aycliffe in 1984.430 pupils attend the new Sugar Hill Primary School which incorporates two large teaching blocks swimming pool,a nursery unit on a 4.5 acre site.Teaching and non-teaching staff total 51.Curriculum development is occurring in Language,Maths., Science,Crafts for Life and Creative Arts.A structured reading scheme,language laboratories,Scottish & Peak Maths. plus the introduction of setting are aimed at establishing individualised learning.Many topics start from direct contact by pupils' excursions or from visitors to school. Physical Education is widening,using the facilities of the recreation centres.Parents are becoming more involved and 1985-86 is likely to see the start of a Home/School Association
